Articles.Content:
I want to start a series of challenges making use of the Ferram Aerodynamics Research (FAR) mod, first of all because I think it's a cool mod and I'd like to popularize it, and second because it makes challenges involving atmospheric flight much more interesting.

My first challenge in this series is designed to be an aerodynamics stress test - Jool diving!

The rules are simple:

1.) Starting from a circular orbit no higher than 500km above Jool, descend as deeply into Jool's atmosphere as you dare, and then return to a stable orbit.

2.) You must use the FAR mod.

3.) Mods which provide diagnostic tools (such as Kerbin Engineer) are allowed; no other mods may be used. For mods that provide both diagnostic tools and other functionality, only the diagnostics may be used.

4.) MechJeb may be used for diagnostics, but this is as much a piloting skills challenge as it is a build challenge so under no circumstances may the MechJeb autopilot be activated.

5.) All craft must contain at least one manned pod, which must be returned to a stable Jool orbit for successful completion of the challenge. Other parts may be decoupled and dropped to a Joolian doom.

6.) At no point may the craft exceed an altitude of 500km above Jool. (This is to prevent people from using a high-speed flyby to assist them in getting back to orbit. You can still build speed by burning on the initial plunge if you so desire.)

7.) You may cheat your craft into Joolian orbit using HyperEdit or save file editing to save time; launching from Kerbin is not necessary.

8.) Scoring is based on minimum altitude achieved.

9.) At least three screenshots are required for proof: one in orbit prior to the dive, one at minimum altitude, and one back in orbit showing apoapsis and periapsis. I encourage you to post more (or videos) for posterity's sake.

To start things off, here's my attempt:

I don't expect this record to stand for very long, this is just to get the ball rolling and provide an example dive. I used less than half the available delta-v on my craft during this run, so I know I can go much lower.
